creator: apurv_anand@yahoo.com
text:
If the web methods in a service are too many, the data (Web Methods, Protocol, Server name/IP, Port, Path etc) does not populate.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a test plan.
- Add Thread Group.
- Add Sampler -> Web Service (SOAP) Request.
- Provide a WSDL URL (https://<server>/<service>.svc?wsdl)
- Click on Load WSDL

Results: Web methods are not populated.
Expected results: Web methods should get populated. 

Note: This bug only appears for services that have many web methods (I have 50+ methods).

This feature works fine for services with lesser number of methods (have checked with services having 5-6 methods).

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Could also be due to WSDL version; JMeter does not support the latest version.

This is not a critical issue, because the WSDL parser is only a convenience - it is not required for the sampler to work.

This can't be fixed without further info:
- sample WSDL file that fails
- shorter version of same that succeeds
- jmeter.log files from both sessions

Please attach these to the Bugzilla issue.

Or a patch, of course.

Created attachment 26059
WSDL used in JMETER..JMeter is not populating the details from WSDL

Team,
I am facing the same issue with JMeterv2.4.My wsdl with 1 webmethod is not getting populated(attached).
creator: sharon.z.bose@aexp.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> Created an attachment (id=26059) [details]
> WSDL used in JMETER..JMeter is not populating the details from WSDL
> 
> Team,
> I am facing the same issue with JMeterv2.4.My wsdl with 1 webmethod is not
> getting populated(attached).

The WSDL is invalid. This is clearly displayed as an error message by JMeter:

Attribute "xmlns:soap11" was already specified for element "wsdl:definitions".

Fix the WSDL and try again.

Sorry, just realised that won't help. Soap 1.1 is not supported.

creator: sharon.z.bose@aexp.com
text:
Created attachment 26062
Updated wsdl

Team I attached the wrong wsdl which I was trying to playaround to make it work in JMeter.Attaching the original wsdl.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
The new WSDL appears to be syntactically correct.

However, it is using a more recent version of the WSDL spec.
This is not supported.

creator: sharon.z.bose@aexp.com
text:
(In reply to comment #6)
> The new WSDL appears to be syntactically correct.
> However, it is using a more recent version of the WSDL spec.
> This is not supported.

So what should I do to make it work..any changes proposed?

Parsing the WSDL is optional - it's not necessary to run a test.

AIUI the new WSDL format is not all that easy to decode - there are lots of options - so it's unlikely that the code will be fixed in the near future, if at all. Also the WebService Sampler does not work with the current version of SOAP either.

If you can provide a patch to fix the code, then please create a new Bugzilla enhancement issue, and attach it to that.

This issue was originally probably about a different failure, which is why a new issue is needed.
creator: sebb@apache.org
